intro: Armeria transmontana subsp. pseudotransmontana, commonly known as the Sierra sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and coastal habitats. This subspecies is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient and hardy plant.
